data.title: Mahatma Gandhi Bunkar Bima Yojana (MGBBY)
data.description: The Government of India had launched the Bunkar Bima Yojana for Handloom Weavers to provide insurance cover by associating with Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC). Under this scheme, the government provides insurances that apply to all community weavers in the case of natural death, accidental death as well as partial and permanent disability due to an accident. The concerned handloom authority in the state will finalise the insurance coverage, as the Life Insurance Corporation of India administers the scheme.
eligibilityCriteria: For those who need to be insured under this scheme, has to satisfy the below-following conditions to avail the benefits of the Scheme.
The weaver’s income must earn at least 50% of his income from handloom weaving.
All weavers must be between 18 to 59 years of age which includes minorities, women weavers and weavers belonging to North East Region are eligible to apply for this insurance scheme.

The scheme is applicable to the weavers those who are belonging to the State Handloom Development Corporations/Apex/Primary Handloom Weavers and Cooperative Societies will be covered under the Scheme. Outside co-operative weavers are also covered under the scheme when they provide an eligibility certificate from the State Directorate of Handlooms.
The State Director in charge of Handlooms is responsible for checking the eligibility of the weavers who are intended to be covered under this scheme.

The concerned State Director and LIC are responsible to ensure that the women weavers belonging to minorities and weavers of the NER States that includes the states like Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Nagaland, Tripura, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram and Sikkim are given adequate representation while implementing the scheme.
In the event of natural death of the member, a Sum Assured of INR 60,000 will become payable to the nominee.
In the cause of Accidental Death or Total Permanent Disability, a Sum Assured of INR 1,50,000 will become payable to the nominee. In case of Partial Disability, a Sum Assured of INR 75,000

eligibilityCriteria: For enrolment in June, July and August – Full Annual Premium of Rs. 330/- is payable.
For enrolment in September, October and November – pro rata premium of Rs.258/- is payable.
For enrolment in December, January and February – pro rata premium of Rs.172/- is payable.
For enrolment in March, April and May – pro rata premium of Rs.86/- is payable.

data.description: will be an Accident Insurance Scheme offering accidental death and disability cover for death or disability on account of an accident. The scheme would be offered/administered through Public Sector General Insurance Companies (PSGICs) and other General Insurance companies willing to offer the product on similar terms with necessary approvals and tie up with Banks for this purpose. Participating banks will be free to engage any such insurance company for implementing the scheme for their subscribers.

In case a member is covered through more than one account and premium is received by the Insurance Company inadvertently, insurance cover will be restricted to one bank account only and the premium paid for duplicate insurance(s) shall be liable to be forfeited.

If the insurance cover is ceased due to any technical reasons such as insufficient balance on due date or due to any administrative issues, the same can be reinstated on receipt of full annual premium, subject to conditions that may be laid down. During this period, the risk cover will be suspended and reinstatement of risk cover will be at the sole discretion of Insurance Company.

Participating banks will deduct the premium amount in the same month when the auto debit option is given, preferably in May of every year, and remit the amount due to the Insurance Company in that month itself.

data.title: Assistance to the Trainees of Handloom Sector
data.description: Under the scheme, candidates are selected for the seats fixed by the Government of India every year for the trainees of the three-year diploma course studying at the Indian Institute of Handloom Technology, Chowkaghat, Varanasi. The amount of scholarship is payable by the Government of India and the State Government to the trainees of the first, second, and third year on the basis of 50:50. In which in the form of state, for first year students INR 500.00 per student, for second year students INR 550.00 per student and for third year students at the rate of INR 600.00 per student for 10 months (July to April) Scholarship funds are provided for. At present, 45 seats have been earmarked for the students of Uttar Pradesh for the three-year diploma course of Indian Institute of Handloom Technology, Chowkaghat, Varanasi by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India. In the financial year 2021-22, a total budget of INR 7.19 lakh (Rupees seven lakh nineteen thousand only) is proposed for the scholarship of first, second, and third year students for the three-year diploma course of Indian Institute of Handloom Technology, Chowkaghat, Varanasi.

data.title: Reimbursement of Exemption in Electricity Rate to Powerloom Weavers
data.description: From the year 2006, it was decided by the Government of Uttar Pradesh to supply electricity at flat rate to the powerloom weavers of the state. In which INR 130.00 per loom is being given by weavers of urban area and INR 37.50 per loom by weavers of rural area. At present, a new scheme is proposed to meet the complaints of misuse of electricity and according to the demand of weavers, which is under consideration at the government level. The implementation of the scheme is done by the Handloom Department in coordination with the Regional Assistant Commissioner, Handlooms and officers of the Energy Department. For the purpose of benefiting the powerloom weavers of the state in the financial year 2020-21, the approval of a budget of INR 15000.00 lakh (Rupees one billion and fifty crore only) has been received. The sanctioned amount of INR 15000.00 lakh (Rupees one billion and fifty crore only) has been handed over to the Managing Director, Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Ltd. Lucknow. In the financial year 2021-22, a proposal of INR 25000.00 lakh (Rupees two billion and fifty crore only) is proposed under the scheme of rebate in electricity rate to powerloom weavers.

data.title: Reimbursement of Exemption in Electricity Rate to Handloom Weavers
data.description: Under the scheme, it has been decided by the Government of Uttar Pradesh to provide electricity subsidy to handloom weavers like powerloom weavers from the financial year 2015-16. Under the scheme, weavers are given exemption in electricity bills at the rate of INR 328 per month and INR 3936 per annum. A budget provision of INR 500.00 lakh has been made in the financial year 2020-21. whose expenditure is being processed. For reimbursement of exemption in electricity rates to 12703 handloom weavers in the financial year 2021-22, per handloom weaver electricity connection INR Budget will be required. Therefore, in the financial year 2021-22, a budget of INR 500.00 lakh (Rupees five crore only) is proposed under the scheme to compensate handloom weavers for rebate in electricity rate.

data.title: Chief Minister Handloom Weavers Award Scheme
data.description: Handloom weavers play an important role in preserving the heritage of traditional art and culture of Indian society. To stop the migration of handloom weavers, to preserve the art and culture and to prevent the extinction of this art, it is necessary that the handloom weavers should be stopped by providing special facilities from the state government, so that they earn their living by engaging in handloom business can do At the same time, handloom weavers make an important contribution in preserving Indian culture, tradition and art by working hard throughout their life time. For which it is necessary to give respect to the handloom weavers on behalf of the government. To improve and give respect to the miserable economic condition of handloom weavers, only such handloom weavers will be eligible, whose minimum age is 60 years, but there will be no restriction of maximum age, that is, after selection, they will be entitled for this honor till the rest of their life. Under the scheme INR 500.00 per weaver is payable per month. The guidelines of the scheme are under process for approval. In anticipation of approval of the guidelines of the scheme, in the financial year 2021-22, a token budget of INR 0-01 Lakh.

data.title: Chief Minister Handloom Weavers Award Scheme
data.description: By creating competition among handloom weavers, they will be motivated to make high quality handloom fabrics. This scheme is being run with the objective of encouraging handloom weavers and improving the economic and social condition of the weavers, increasing their productivity and improving the quality. At present, keeping in view the scenario of diversification and change of clothes according to the increasing competition and technological development, this scheme is being implemented to provide assistance, support, encouragement and rewards to the weavers working in the handloom industry.
